result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal Ann Hatten

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

$300 posted
Standard conditions:
Add'l conditions:
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements

11:13 AM Defendant Crystal Ann Hatten in court.  Attorney Gerard M Werner in court for Crystal Ann Hatten.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court vacates bench warrant. State request an add'l $300 cash.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

4:12 PM Defendant Crystal Ann Hatten not in court.  Attorney Gerard M Werner appeared by phone for Crystal Ann Hatten.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
No appearance by defendant. State request a bench warrant- court orders.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Gerard Werner is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $50.00 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 12/1/2022 @ $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.

3:39 PM Defendant Crystal Ann Hatten in court.  Prosecuting attorney Corey R. Hoze in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant does not qualify for public defender, filled out petition for court appt. attorney.  
Court will appoint an attorney and extend time limits. $50/month commencing 12.1.22 for payment plan.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
